perturbation.original_text: Before expiration of the Term, either Party may terminate this Agreement upon: (i) any material breach of the Agreement by the other Party, if such breach is not remedied to the reasonable satisfaction of the non-breaching Party within ten (10) business days after written notice
perturbation.changed_text: Before expiration of the Term, either Party may terminate this Agreement upon: (i) any material breach of the Agreement by the other Party, if such breach is not remedied to the reasonable satisfaction of the non-breaching Party within five (5) business days after written notice
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the cure period for a material breach from ten (10) business days to five (5) business days may be considered unreasonable in many jurisdictions, particularly when dealing with complex contractual obligations. This shorter timeframe potentially violates the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing present in most contracts, as it may not allow the breaching party sufficient time to rectify the issue. Some states might view this as an attempt to unfairly force termination.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing; potential violation of state contract law principles regarding reasonable notice and opportunity to cure.

perturbation.original_text: The Association must be a named additional insured, and shall be provided at least 30 days' notice for cancellation of policy and 10 days' notice for non-payment of premium.
perturbation.changed_text: The Association must be a named additional insured, and shall be provided at least 10 days' notice for cancellation of policy and 5 days' notice for non-payment of premium.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notice period for cancellation of an insurance policy to 10 days and notice for non-payment to 5 days violates standard insurance regulations and practices. Most states require insurance companies to provide at least 30 days' notice for cancellation to allow the insured party sufficient time to obtain replacement coverage. A shorter notice period leaves the Association vulnerable to unexpected lapses in coverage, potentially resulting in significant financial losses. Additionally, a 5 day notice for non-payment before policy cancellation goes against industry norms as most allow a 10 day grace period.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State insurance regulations regarding cancellation notice periods; general principles of insurance contract law.

perturbation.original_text: All other originals and copies of the Association Marks (whether in printed, electronic, recorded, and/or other tangible form) shall be discarded or destroyed within five (5) business days.
perturbation.changed_text: All other originals and copies of the Association Marks (whether in printed, electronic, recorded, and/or other tangible form) shall be discarded or destroyed within one (1) business days.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the timeframe for destruction of materials containing the Association Marks from five (5) business days to one (1) business day following termination or expiration may be considered unreasonably short, particularly for larger organizations with extensive distribution networks. This may violate the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing. It might not provide adequate time to ensure complete removal of the marks from all materials, increasing the risk of unauthorized use. Courts may find this timeframe insufficient and unenforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing; state contract law principles regarding reasonable timeframes for compliance.
